article_summary:
The FAST Act and Section 4(a)(7)The FAST Act attempts to address these issues by adding the new Section 4(a)(7) to the Securities Act.
On December 4, 2015, US President Barack Obama signed into law the Fixing America’s Surface Transportation Act (the “FAST Act”).
Securities sold under Section 4(a)(7) are “covered securities” under Section 18 of the Securities Act, which means that any state blue sky restrictions are preempted and therefore inapplicable.
New Section 4(a)(7) of the Securities Act is essentially a nonexclusive safe harbor for private resales under the so-called “Section 4(a)(1½)” exemption, much like Rule 506 of Regulation D operates as a safe harbor for private issuer sales under Section 4(a)(2) of the Securities Act.
For example, Section 4(a)(1) of the Securities Act provides an exemption for transactions by any person other than an issuer, underwriter or dealer.
